column4: Hi there, I'm new to ubuntu, just upgraded a machine from RH9 to hoary.
i'm trying to figure out the repositories. Universe & multiverse, specifically.
I haven't been able to find documentation that tells me what I want to consider when deciding whether to use them. Is it riskier? less stable?
well, the more software you have, the greater risk you are in terms of security regardless of what the software is
you have more software, therefore a greater potential for bugs...
right, makes sense
ubuntu is pretty stable though. i have not personally had any problems with it
if you setup a firewall, do not run any services, and don't hand out any accounts, you should be ok even if there are a few problems
and you use, all, universe, multiverse, etc?
well, whatever i need :)
this is my gf's workstation, i mainly want to keep it simple and stable for her.
it really comes down to not where the package is located, but the quality of a given package
so its really hard to say
but am working on gettting java working
i use the jdk supplied by sun.com
go download it, slap it in /opt, and edit your .bashrc
ok, so the different sections don't really say "this has seen more reviewing by the team", etc?

they are primarily concerned with providing a good base (OS)
ok, i was trying to figure that out
that's why the universe is not enabled by default
